6Luuzy84kyJFEuP7bAvMoQ.text: Located in CityScape downtown Squid Ink has a killer happy hour.   Perusing through the menu I found much to my delight! The philly roll and the spicy salmon roll were fresh and small. I prefer small rolls, the kind you can actually fit in your mouth and not have to awkwardly bite in half with chop sticks. I also had the green bean tempura, and the chicken wings which are chargrilled, bathed in siracha and served with shiso ranch. The star of the show was the miso black cod, pan seared and served with leeks, the miso glaze was intoxicating.   I couldn't believe how cheap the dinner and 2 sake bombers turned out to be.   DID I MENTION HAPPY HOUR IS EVERY DAY UNTIL 7!!

xHKTArBo9hHj2Nv5gsajsA.text: We came on a Sunday night. The service was impeccable and the sushi was all really good. I tried the Thai fried rice and Loved it. The rice was enough for 2 people. The cougar roll was a little weird but still really good. It was pretty expensive, but we did drink. I'd definitely go back.

v4FJttoiT_Tm4NS36xUxYw.text: Atmosphere great for relaxing with friends , date or for me unwinding. Chef Juan is meticulous and on point.  The person taking my order asked great questions so I get what I want. Everything made this a great meal and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Combination rolls are my fav. Many textures and taste all making out.  Will be here every night of my stay

i5nIQWnwJhMbmfk4rw7HAw.text: Ok food and service sucks. The only reason they are still in business is because they are the only sushi downtown. Sunday afternoon only one other table and waitress is just the worst. Stay away n go the extra distance for gas station sushi.

JpvVpyMB3Rn6rssMQZynpw.text: We went here after a concert last night and ordered two sakes,  a salad and a lot of their top teir sushi.  Unfortunately,  we our waiter a total of 3 times. The restaurant was far from busy abs he had plenty of time to chat with his buddies but no time to ask how the meal even was. I have never thought about walking out of a place before bit he wouldn't even come to us with the check!   We sat there for two hours worth empty waters.

aK6-37IWCTvD3LX93rTy5A.text: Great Food... Stopped for lunch at Squid Ink for sushi. The service and food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Superb sushi and superb presentation
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sushi presentation was great. The food was fabulous.

TT7pDpclXC540kM4R3nsSQ.text: This is the type of sushi establishment that's more of a place to see and be seen than to enjoy a quality meal. That's why all the effort goes into a posh-looking bar. That's why the sushi has funny names (lol Pokemon Roll so kawaii) more memorable than quality.   Against my better judgment, I decided to go with a simple, tempura roll. The Vegas. It was executed quite poorly, as it was almost flavorless (how do you manage that when it has unagi?), and very gummy, indicating it was...uh...undercooked. Portion size was also questionable for the price, which would never bother me if the quality was at least average. I can legitimately say it's the worst Vegas roll I've ever had. I have had better sushi on several college campuses.   Next are the uninspired cocktails. Shiso leaf left untouched is a cool marketing tool to make a cocktail sound vaguely eastern, but it's neither flavorful nor aromatic enough when chilled to be anything more than an unfamiliar garnish in an otherwise forgettable libation. Only the "City Escape" stands out. Everything else is just a shot, some fruit juice, and some muddled "seasonal" fruit. How special can these drinks be if ingredients are strikingly interchangeable? Where is the cucumber? Lychee? I am disappointed. Oh, and the happy hour is pretty lame. IIRC, there's no reverse HH, something I'm more than happy to find down the road at 11pm.   A sushi bar that messes up sushi is already looking at 2-star territory. Atmosphere is nice and trendy, but that's negated by below average value. I'm still open to giving it another try someday, so I won't go any lower.

YvDHlXldSTmVkKTcaKV7Eg.text: I've been here a few times and really like this place.  In a sea of downtown bars full of TV sets and burgers, this is a nice island of relative tranquility.  Now at wintertime, you can look outside the window and see the skaters in CitySkate.  While there may be a TV at the bar, I don't see or hear it at any other table, and see nothing but their funky murals or other patrons enjoying a skillfully made meal.  I've generally just ordered sushi, which is presented without adornment on shiny white porcelain of different shapes.  Everything tastes nice and fresh, the nori is nice and crispy, and they are inventive with different combinations of house rolls.  Just don't expect to be in and out of here fast.  You generally can expect an hour's stay, even on a not-too-busy day.  But that's ok, good sushi should be savored, with the eyes and the mouth.    I once got green tea ice cream for dessert, and the serving was very generous...enough for 3 people.  The service is always friendly and professional.  Expect to pay a bit of money.  This is fresh fish in the desert, not a McDonald's hamburger.  Set your expectations accordingly and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the House Rolls at Squid Ink.  Quite tasty!  Currently offered at $2 off at lunchtime with complimentary miso soup.

kG1NpnWzHTaW2JzZBSJb0A.text: The food here was pretty descent. It's pretty hard to mess up a California roll. However, my friend mentioned several times to the waiter that she was vegan and she still ended up with cream cheese in her food. The server disappeared for a long time and not even the hostess could find him. Average sushi, with crap service.

7L4-rcl-UKjKEGcc-_YBUw.text: We always have a great experience when we eat here. Nester the sushi chef always goes out of his way to make us amazing rolls or recommends new things to try.  We always eat here when we are in town!

5S8DLf5QBBHDomSEEyeOHw.text: I came here with my boyfriend on this past Sunday. It was right after the Dodgers vs Diamondbacks game ( the Dodgers won!! Yay!). My boyfriends family had previously come here and loved the food and atmosphere and recommended us to come and try it. It was a little stormy so we came in and escaped the rain just before it started Pouring. We were seated right away and were given menus with a pretty wide selection of sushi and other foods. I got the flying Phoenix and my boyfriend got the buffalo chicken. Let me just tell you this was the best sushi I had ever had. It was so good and fresh. And the garlic edamame wow! So so yummy! We will definitely be coming back to squid ink next year for our annual Arizona trip!

kYYE9RxZJUoGxTGfRZeUwA.text: I could not be more disappointed. I just ordered take out and paid nearly $70. I received a roll, Kobe short ribs and crab rangon.  The Kobe had 4 horrible small pieces of meat thats is anything but a rib. the crab rangon was 4 pieces of fake crab meat in wontons and the roll I am uncertain of it's authenticity... King crab I am highly doubtful .... I am shocked this place is trying to opperate this way. Food allergies are real and fake crab should never be called crab.

WzoJr_Z-8EGZWCQX3JB6MQ.text: To start off I had the tempura green beans which were light and airy, but I have had better else where. I had the ravenous roll (personal fav) and I tried a new one called Tahoe roll which was very tasty but had a weird texture inside that I couldn't figure out what it was. For drinks I had a sake sunrise which was so tasty. Overall my experience was good for a quick lunch downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ravenous Roll bottom  Tahoe Roll at the top  Drink: sake sunrise

RaZfHT-KToRCMLIrV8MgAA.text: I went during happy hour to this place and the Sushi rolls were very small. I ordered a regular roll not on happy hour and guess what,  it was the same size as the happy hour roll!!!! The only good thing was bourbon and cokes were only 4$

XnxJNwQv8LwGfaBtDVplfQ.text: I got lunch here with a friend and was quite impressed with the ramen. The pork broth was full of flavor, and it was just loaded with noodles and bok choy and nori and even a poached egg. Incredibly filling and good bang for your buck. The edamame was good, too. The sushi was just okay--I tried a rainbow sushi and it wasn't quite as fresh as I'd expected. Would definitely come back for ramen, though!

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ramen

jDSzeMX8XKdJBI_RrxpxQQ.text: Sushi rolls are overpriced for the quality and size. Paid $15 for a very basic roll. Even the classic California roll was probably the worst I've ever had. My husband loved his teriyaki chicken bowl however so not a total waste.

JQ8gD5xKehTubN5jQRA-UA.text: I came here for happy hour, which we made into our dinner, while I was visiting Phoenix. Happy hour prices are great, and who doesn't love saving some money. The restaurant is hip and trendy with a cool vibe. We got to sit a large round table in the middle of the restaurant with a cool mural in the back, awesome photo opportunity!   Food and cocktails were honestly just mediocre, not good and not bad, but not memorable. I got a couple rolls and one cocktail, and didn't think much of anything I got.   What I do remember was the great service! We were in a pretty large group, and they got all our orders correct. They were also really nice in giving us separate bills, and everything was accurate.   I don't know when I'll be back in Phoenix, but this is a good restaurant to check out if you're in the mood for some happy hour sushi and cocktails.

MDR2D5OoU0FIW0WWiIxr0A.text: Came here while visiting Phoenix with my mom. Sat at the bar. Everyone seemed busy as we arrive two min before happy hour ended. Friendly bartenders but not super attentive. Needed to ask for silverware once our food arrived.  The miso soup is delicious and so is the seaweed salad. Sushi is good but pricey! Got surf and turf roll and eel cucumber.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DwGfzyHOOOEL2bN14RqSqA.text: I regret recommending this place, service was so inattentive. When you personally have to get up and go find someone for a refill, an item they missed, or ask for the check it's super frustrating. Not to mention incredibly awkward staring at the table waiting, looking around hoping to get anybody's attention. Just because we weren't a large party or ordering alcohol doesn't mean we're any less of a priority.   The food was also lackluster. I've ordered Dragon Rolls at many sushi restaurants in the valley and never has it ever come with shrimp (which is why I ordered it and they don't make you aware that it does) I guess they are trying to be unique because two of the pieces come with a fried shrimp tail which I wasn't a fan of so I removed it only to see that there was nothing else filled inside, just a gaping hole. So for a $14 roll two of the pieces were basically just seaweed and rice. The pieces are small as it is so this felt like a complete waste of money but by the time our waiter bothered to stop by and ask how everything was it was way too late and I was ready to leave.  For our first time experience, SquidInk left us with a horrible first impression and quite literally a bad taste in our mouths. I won't be returning and wouldn't recommend to anyone. If you are planning on a romantic dinner or a nice night out I'd look elsewhere, there are plenty of other restaurants in walking distance and it seems like the poor service we received is consistent among other reviews.

yOfM9KUvor8zxa2f7ES0oA.text: It can't be too surprising that sushi in Phoenix Arizona isn't that good. I had sushi me yellowtail, tuna roll, and tuna tartare. The tuna tartare was dry and flavorless, and point-blank disgusting. I was sitting at the bar the rest of the meal was OK. My bartender was pleasant. However I notice she didn't care to ask if my meal was OK. If you're ever in the mood for sushi, do not eat at this location.  Cleanliness/bathroom: 3/10  Professionalism/staff: 5/10  Food: 3/10

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Late night snack.

_PEIDIYDDksfhPE1sC8zkw.text: Very welcoming and friendly. Sam was awesome and the sushi was amazing. Def would come back for more

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

x4Tyt63gGgHb86izhUdeuw.text: This is a good solid sushi place when in downtown. It's best to come here on happy hour where they have some pretty good deals including a full beer and Sake for $8 and our favorite the Las Vegas roll for $10.  We like coming here before a Suns game or just when we are downtown. It's a great spot to sit at the bar, have a few drinks and watch the city pass by!

Rj4ButxHzUjqPo2kRG6E-A.text: Squid Ink has become our go to for sushi since moving downtown.  The food is great and the atmosphere is awesome, it's really nice to sit at the bar and look out on Central Avenue or sit on the patio.  The happy hour is amazing, 4 - 7 and reverse from 10 - midnight, half off appetizers and drink specials, try the specialty cocktail, the "Deep Water", it's delicious and the happy hour price is $5.    You can hit Squid Ink before the game and still get the happy hour prices, unlike the places close to the ballpark who suspend their happy hours on game day or during special events, which is super lame.    Come down during the holiday season and enjoy looking at the ice skating rink, it's really nice.    Katie usually bartends for us, she is super nice, super attentive, and super knowledgeable about drinks, the menu, sushi, and other bars and restaurants in the valley.  If her boss is reading this, she deserves a raise.

00Iq1QDV3IbMtc-WIUYTDQ.text: I visited this location with a group during Phoenix Comic Fest. We arrived at about 5:30 on a Saturday and were seated right away. Our table location felt pretty cramped but otherwise the atmosphere was quite pleasant, not too loud, and the service was good.  I had the Tune in Tokyo cocktail to drink, and it was AMAZING. I'd definitely order that again. For my main dish, I ordered the duck confit bowl, but the server returned to inform me that duck wouldn't be available for another two hours. That was a bummer, but there were still plenty of other appealing choices. I went with the Beef Short Rib Bowl.  The restaurant was really filling up at this point but our food didn't take long to come out. I loved my dish. The beef short ribs had an amazing and deep flavor; the only negative is that a few of the pieces were really large and awkward to eat with chopsticks. The flavors within my bowl contrasted and complemented each other well, from the freshness of the rice to the acidic tang of the kimchi to the softness of the egg. Great stuff all around.  I've already told my husband that he needs to come here with me sometime when we're in downtown. Maybe then I can try the duck... and that macadamia nut bread pudding...

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Short Rib Bowl
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Part of the cocktail menu May 2018

A35zZfEeOf7sxRNtri75Fg.text: Went here for a girls night during happy hour and had a great time! Laid back, friendly staff, couldn't complain! They even had two ladies walking around sampling different drinks you could then order from the bar, so we let the drinks flow (tune in Tokyo to be exact) the garlic edamame speak for itself, and rolled our way through: the Vegas, california (yes we are basic), avocado, and vegetarian (which wAs my favorite, tempura fried asparagus anyone?!). All in all it was a lovely evening with good food.

uHezP9Sivs9AHMWuTHsQIQ.text: Tasty sushi for sure. Came here for dinner on a Friday night and everything we tried was good. The tuna and salmon were great, the garlic edamame was wonderful.  Rolls were creative and like I said very tasty. The staff was good but some of the seating is kinda tight. Not a big deal but one of my table members kept getting kicked in the chair leg a few times.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber Tuna Roll
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bento
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Roll

0-ijP95f4kE7nEdB4nDAUQ.text: Wow excellent sushi and nice atmosphere for a simple place right there downtown phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unexpected - great venue
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. unexpected - more of the gallery
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unexpected - from of the gallery looking out

acbfrotR370_6DPMt5LpmA.text: Came in with a party of 5 for birthday and was told t would be a few minutes when the gentleman completely forgot about us and somebody else had to help us ten minutes later when they noticed us. We were sat offered either the bar or a very small booth that made it uncomfortable for us to be able to sit and eat comfortably. It was Saturday night and they were not that busy and yet they didn't have enough glasses for our waters, so we had to share until they were able to bring our fifth water. Our food took a little bit longer than usual, however the food was good as always. When we asked for two forks, again they didn't have enough so they brought us a fork and a spoon.

DgDQvtq59q-i7VkLTkiVQA.text: Prices are high, sushi is good, the ramen needs a lot of work. Not good, it's rare I don't finish a meal. I did not finish the ramen. It was the noodle and the pork belly that weren't very good. I got the spicy sal on roll with I did enjoy very much. Service was fine, nothing bad but nothing spectacular. Would go back for sushi.

FYLMJtawSZ9kdrzF4tHbSw.text: Went there the night U2 played they were slammed but the food was great and the service was good as well. Kate our bartender did a great job. Loved the Dirty Rockstar sushi.

EyRugj7pCzb-KLDPELDunQ.text: Flies, flies, flies! Everywhere! We asked to be seated outside because they were literally crawling all over the inside windows. Our waitress was not friendly or helpful , she didn't take down our order correctly which normally would be cool if my tab wasn't wasn't 30$ for a roll and  a sake bomber I didn't order. The sushi wasn't bad, it wasn't special our overall experience was very negative (we're both in the service industry) not being harsh whatsoever we will not be returning

1yeS604X0KyCJ0uqCbYkjw.text: I didn't eat the food but my friends were not impressed with the portions or the speed of the service. Their consensus was that the sushi and potstickers were ok but the rest of the food was bland and luke warm. The waitress seemed to be having a rough night and it may be due to a holiday rush. That said, I may not consider coming here again if other options in the area are available.

zFKtARxWg1wqIDK_v_dH7Q.text: Sushi is just alright. Service leaves a lot to be desired. I stopped with a group of six, 3 couples. We all placed our order and their food arrived but ours hadn't. Apparently, the waiter took it to the wrong table TWICE! After waiting 40 minutes for sushi, we got fed up and left. Ended up eating at Burger King down the street.

O3_AuL1quPJQ6gk77g2USA.text: One of my favorite places to go for happy hour. They have great deals on rolls and drinks. Eat outside and enjoy beautiful downtown Phoenix. #Phx

j_Z7JjttZGUo6xSqB_Wnuw.text: Excellent service!! Victor was phenominal and i could not be happier with my first visit. The happy hour all day sunday was perfect for my friends and I! We will definitley be back!

V84xXQ0MT3Bb4J1D894Zyw.text: I stopped in for a quick bite at lunchtime. The server was fast, friendly, and very professional! My squid & seaweed salads came out fast. I highly recommend this place. Only downside was parking but that's to be expected downtown.

BbJdvekk7ZO1sm5me3UBhA.text: Its not bad but I've had better. This place is definitely pricey the minimum you will spent is $8 and that is just an appetizer. The sushi tasted really fresh but my issue is that they use way too much rice on both the nigiri style and the rolls. Service was decent the waiter was decent, he was quick but never asked if we wanted refills on water. The cleaning service was even quicker, some friends had gotten up to for a smoke and before we even noticed they had cleaned up their unfinished beers and sake. Happened once and almost happened a second time.

Zh4_LNzzV7mGNIMN3hmyPw.text: Delicious sushi - you can never go wrong with this place. My favorite is the surf and turf roll. I also had a cocktail which i can't remember the name of, but it had ginger in it and it was just delicious. Everything is good here! The potstickers are to die for as well.

J7MmOWCS2ZS1QlXKmDSS8w.text: First two times I went, I loved it and was very excited. Whenever new places open downtown, I feel such pride. Unfortunately, it's been less than impressive my past few trips (I know. I should stop trying.) The sushi wasn't great, my table was dirty and so were the ones around me, and the service was slow. If you're just going for a drink and edamame, this place fits the bill. Anything more and I suggest you go elsewhere.

MU6LYSc6LVoUsA0J9pZfwA.text: I went for the surf n turf roll and I was not disappointed. The service was awesome (thank you Victor), the food was delicious, and the wine was perfection. Overall a great place to dine! We will be returning.

mHOoTjo1HDLZQQvjJYbcVw.text: This place has location going for it, good service, but the quality of the fish, and selection is sub par.

JjgbklF6fAR_eY076dhpRg.text: Had the beef yakisoba to go. I must say, for a dish like this "to-go" it was great. Lots of flavor, the beef was cooked perfect and tender.  A big plus for me was the vegetables were not mushy, steamed just right.

XjdhRXOCB2HZRvsekoBt-Q.text: I can say without a doubt my favorite sushi place in all of Phoenix and topped off with great service. Has a beautiful woman behind the bar (alicea) that really makes this place shine and keeps me coming back. I highly recommend this place so please come in and see alicea and see what its all about!

wIzUlkVksTVmSgv9Sntb1Q.text: Went here for dinner with some friends last night. Very modern sushi bar with some mood lighting that was a bit too dark. We all used our phones for reading of the menus. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen and 3 rolls. The sushi was amazing, fresh and clean tasting. The ramen was good, liked the slices of pork belly, crab meat and the soft boiled egg topped it off. The ramen soup however tasted off. If anything i'd recommend they work on improving the taste of the soup. Besides the lighting and soup, all was awesome!

qGMp1NDLoR515hGGnTPXPg.text: we came here for quick drinks, service was poor and the food was mediocre

3gZAmkoTgBxGao0g0htOhg.text: Although the wait was long for the food at 1pm on a Wednesday, the sushi was tasty.  I especially enjoyed the tempura roll.  Next time I will skip the garlic edamame though.  Nothing special there

IHdHFtjqskPGcf7Zh7Waag.text: Went there for the first time last Saturday for my birthday dinner. Beautiful Resturant plenty of room for my table of 10, friendly staff and the food was D-lish. I had a great time there and will defiantly go back.

0I42rlzU-Rj3YyDmKGP9pg.text: I'm not a huge fan of their rolls (a little overly creative without great taste behind it), but every time I go for lunch I get the sushi or sashimi lunch platter. You know, the basics. And they are AMAZING. The sashimi is so lovely. It's big slices of fish that are some of the most delicious sashimi I've had in PHX. I typically don't like salmon and I gobble this up. The sashimi lunch is $15 and I'd say its 4 slices of yellowtail, tuna, and salmon. Worth every penny.

-5-Sy-3GGwX_0wLYTFOEVw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the food here. The Ultimate Philly roll was great, but the Beef Yakisoba bowl blew me away. The steak was perfectly cooked, and all of the flavors together made me a return customer. Highly recommended.

bdAP_ANCI1lE_QQsICHAwQ.text: The best sushi ever! Had the ultimate Philly roll and cougar roll. Christian was my server and he was just as good as the sushi!

PRXCMZXB0aHapCu9JuIheQ.text: We sat outside in the bar as the heat lamps were perfect with the weather. I ordered the special drink for the night the ginger tini and it was crisp and refreshing. I ordered the Ramen and my friend ordered the curry chicken. We both enjoyed our meals as they were cooked perfect, portioned perfect and tasted wonderful. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the bartenders were friendly and helpful with suggestions on what would be good to order. I  recommend this place and enjoyed my time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Refreshing!
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yumm yumm yumm!!! Perfect meal
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food!!!

vHADNXM0-QuMUDLe3rWYAg.text: My boyfriend brought me in here for a lunch date and I was extremely Happy with everything! Food was delicious and the bartender was super nice & attentive to us. Thanks for providing us with a great experience, we'll definitely be back...

kd3ng11CGiVBKRXuJ2ykEQ.text: Great sushi. Yellowtail sashimi was fresh, rock star sushi was great. Nice to meet Greg tending bar. A guy with great character.

Abb8evDlf8yJUtPEwNRKrA.text: Sushi was eh.... I like to think I am an adventurous sushi eater...but I wasn't even impressed with just the basic spicy tuna roll. I've had better sushi, let's just say that. Establishment was cool, loved the downtown ambiance.   I visited today, on Veterans Day...and being a Veteran, I playfully asked the bartender if there was a free shot for Veterans today, and she simply said No. That may be True...but at least a lil recognition would have been awesome, maybe with a simple cheap lil shot to say Thank you for your service. I could have gone many other places for Veteran treatment but I got None here. #fail.

oO6nBdHS0vMRqkBFSbQxag.text: My wife and I came here on a Sunday afternoon to grab some drinks and some Veggie rolls. Drinks were cold and made fast. The place was very clean and modern. Staff was excellent and very nice. I ordered 1 roll of the veggie rolls (rice, cucumber, and avocado wrapped in rice paper). It was 1 roll that was sliced into 5 pieces. They were pretty good, but not for $7. Yes, 1 roll for $7. I'm not cheap by any means but I thought for $7 the portion size was super small and not filling at all. Next time I'll try some other stuff and update my review. Cheers!

G9N0KCpBFlDq8pL2rt7NLQ.text: What an absolutely amazing staff that this establishment has!! I live in Peoria and often go to the Squid Ink on Lake Pleasant Pkwy but I have to say there is no comparison to the staff and management of the two establishments. Whatever Tim the manager is doing down on Jefferson - Peoria needs to take some lessons. I am impressed. I have never felt more welcome. The Sushi chefs were amazing- their dishes all a work of art. The hostess was just a joy. The place was packed but we felt like we were important to them. Thank you Tim and thank your staff - it will be worth the trip to eat at your establishment versus driving down the street to your sister restaurant.

CjTBVEks8374YtcQr63LQA.text: Located conveniently next to the ice rink, this sushi place worked as a pre dinner prelude. Honestly it is a sushi restaurant with all the usual suspects. Specialty rolls like Las Vegas or volcano roles, typical nigiri and edamame. It's not a bad option but doesn't stand out too much from other sushi places I've been to in Phoenix. If you want dinner and you're feeling sushi this place will work but I'd do somewhere else for a special occasion.

_LVvdJTJL0s8ZJltaceOIQ.text: Flare, taste, and service all rolled into one  Tagged Squid Ink with a friend before a baseball game.  Very convenient location, event though the name threw me at first.    Sushi is very good for Arizona.  Plating style and service are both top-notch.  Staff was very attentive, took care of us quickly, and the bartender was fun to chat with.  Even got a discount on a Yelp check-in!  Very much enjoyed the Agedashi Tofu, Gyoza, Kale Salad, and Buffalo Roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pre-game Yuma

FaIpcIW7VHBpGQTqx_tY4g.text: Came here with my wife and her friend after a 3 on 3 basketball tournament.  Star 1 is for the food quality. I got the chicken wings. You might be thinking why would you get chicken wings at a sushi place? They were recommended by a friend and they were to die for. The sauce was amazing, the meat was tender, and the ranch dipping sauce was awesome! My wife and her friend got some sushi and said it was okay but nothing to go out of your way for. The star here is based solely on my experience.  Star 2 is for the service. Our waitress always made sure we had what we needed and were taken care of.  Star 3 is for the atmosphere. The atmosphere here is a very cool place to hang out with a group. It is set up in a cool way and there is pretty loud music playing the whole time. It's not some place I would go on an intimate date because I would get way too distracted but it was fun to go with my wife and her friend.  Star 4 is for the food being worth the price. We went in during happy hour which is from 3 to 7 every day! So I got a full order of amazing wings for 7 bucks.  Star 5 is for the wow factor. The wow factor here is for how great the wings were at a sushi place. I would go here again just for the wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gMmXrRXEo6WPEAF616AyHw.text: I liked the vibe of this place but the food was just so so. The happy hour pricing is pretty good.  We ordered an octopus dish that was a special for comicon and the beef negamaki. I am a big fan of octopus, but this wasn't my favorite octopus. The spice was great but the octopus was a little too chewy for my taste. The beef negamaki was much better with a sauce that had a great kick to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef negamaki (great sauce)
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Walking dead special
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Indoor and outdoor bar

6G5LLmObHiE7Ytx8qHhgXw.text: Awesome sushi. I ordered the Ultimate Philly roll and it was everything I could've dreamed of in a roll. Loved it. Plus the Deep Ocean drink was great.  Hit it up for Happy Hour...good selection and prices

WFH7AApdyYcEulGDUkLczA.text: Defiantly one of my new favorite sushi joints. Great atmosphere, friendly & accommodating wait staff, & the fish is so fresh! The rolls here are very unique, & yummy.  If you can't make up your mind on which one you want, just ask your waiter, they are always willing to tell you their favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegas roll
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Citrus Yellowtail
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sushi platter(chefs choice)

io20v3BMeElf9tYIYdgFeg.text: Started with a white wine recommendation from the server, which didn't disappoint. Custard Chardonnay complimented the rest of our happy hour meal.   I ordered my usual green bean tempura, a healthier alternative to fries. Always perfectly cooked. Spicy salmon and shrimp tempura rolls are great choices for happy hour.   FYI all appetizers are half off for happy hour and Tuesdays are half off wine bottles from 7 pm to close. It's a great place to take your friends. And it's in the heart of downtown. The patio is a great place for people watching...  I gave it 4 stars because there were a couple of opprtunistic flies hovering which was annoying. But they were gone after a few minutes. No big.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber and eel sushi. Oishii!

P6XtIF83uoaOw5xiqA7NXA.text: Cute, casual vibe! Decent food and friendly staff! Good for meeting for drinks and small bites. The Coconut Curry Shrimp is an absolute winner! Yummo!

Cu2ZEWudIZkFVH-NLUhoWA.text: I wanted so badly to give this place a 4-star, but I feel it just barely missed the mark. I loved the atmosphere and the patio. However, our only server on the patio was the bartender, who was very busy. So we waited a while for things like water refills. There is no way for her to access the patio without walking all the way around the other side through the restaurant. Not bad if you are sitting at the bar, but not so good if you are sitting at one of the tables. You guys should really split the bar open for access to the patio.   The food was not bad. I got the ramen. I've been to some really good ramen places, and this was just ok. Not the best I've had. My fiancee liked her sushi. The tempura beans were good, but some on the greasy side.   I honestly would give this place another go if some friends wanted to go there, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.   Great concept, just needs some polishing.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The patio was nice
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tempura beans

QLNR3063E3MqbaMRQf6clg.text: Tried this sushi spot's Spicy Tuna Roll, Spicy Crab Roll, and Ramen because it was late, Harumi was closed, and I wondered what relatively cheaper sushi would taste like Downtown. The rolls lacked flavor, the wasabi is weak, and the Ramen tasted a lot like instant with fresh scallions and nori.  Maybe I'll give their nigiri or sashimi a try next time.

df6O9jqQLFgo3JgAkb2pkg.text: This is probably my favorite sushi place I have gone to in Phoenix. The sushi rolls are the right size. So many places make them way too big. Their happy hour menu is amazing. I highly suggest trying to go during their happy hour. They have great deals on food and drinks. If you don't go during happy hour it can get a bit spendy. This place usually requires a reservation if you are coming for dinner hours and I can see why. Space is limited. They did a good job with what they have. If you don't have a reservation expect to wait. The only con in my opinion is that the menu had no description of what the rolls were. I had to ask the waiter. That's a minor inconvenience though.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aTTf5gZ4ux_uOWXK4pgTog.text: Serious let down. Squid ink had reached out to a large group that I am a part of. (an unofficial fan club of Phoenix Comicon with over 10 thousand members) to do a cross promotion with us, Phoenix Comicon, and themselves. They had promised our group leadership an official roll for the event. We spent weeks promoting them to our members, and when we began to arrive, the staff was completely clueless in regards to any promotion and there was no themed roll made for us.   We easily sent them hundreds of people tonight and they completely let us down. I will never return to this business.

ojwhAZgx_4nlMfaRpTk6-g.text: The food was delicious, affordable and presented well. We ordered various sushi rolls and drinks--all of which were prepared well.   While the food might only get four stars, the attentiveness of the staff is really remarkable. The staff was friendly and did not act as if they couldn't help just because you weren't one of their assigned tables.

CRKQ495tQp0V_WD41ZMSfQ.text: Great place to stop by before a downtown game.  Happy hour is every day and even though it was a limited menu I more appreciate the consistency of every day same time (I think they had reverse after 10 too!).  Pot stickers were a fabulous way to start.   The best part was the way they used jalapenos to make the spicy rolls.  It's a different spice but an awesome one paired with sushi. Everything was very very fresh and we are definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rolls!!!
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour

BCyO8CSR6HQ1CTpAWPdTTg.text: For a place in the middle of downtown across both sports stadiums and close to the heart of Phoenix, they offer the worst service I have experienced.  I didn't come here to eat at In-And-Out to serve my own water.  But this is exactly what Squid Ink did.  I sat around and around and around to get my own menus, get my own refills of water, annoy 3 different waiters/waitresses for an order and get my own check.  I honestly have no idea who the heck my waiter was that day.  That is just poor service.  I honestly think some of the workers there are somewhat judgmental too.  They completely ignored me.  I do think it's because of the way I dressed.  It reminds me of going into a luxury car dealership wearing shorts and a t-shirt, there is no help, or any desire to help.  The hostesses didn't even take me to the seat at the bar, they just pointed and told me it was free seating.  Have some proper service or even a smile on your face, it's not even that hard to walk 3 steps to make a customer feel welcomed.    The food is great though if you don't care about service.  In fact, the sushi is one of the best I've tasted and they deserve every recognition from all the magazines and food critics.  Easily a 5 star sushi place.  But the service was so atrocious when I went that I am very hesitant to give them another shot.  Or I can probably try to not look poor.

Mh-7_j8NAnatI1rsw9PuRQ.text: I actually adore squidink for a couple reasons. It's great for solo dates because they have that bar and it's pretty comfortable. Then their crab rangoons are perfect. I love the shape and the crispy textures. It may be weird that they chop crab up instead of the traditional mixture but it works. It's a great appetizer.   I've had a few of their sushi rolls but this time I got the nigiri. It was a little bit larger than other nigiri I've had but I didn't mind.  So in the 90s, Breyer's had an ice cream called Fruit Rainbow. The Green Tea ice cream tastes KINDA like it before your mouth goes numb. It's like nostalgia in a little cup. I'll be back always just for it!

tPKiFA13qwmIQR6C153bbw.text: I am sold!!! So this restaurant is right next to the hotel... and it's sushi... I can't NOT try it. Happy hour is 3-6! No one is here! LOL win! The potstickers are to die for. Just the greatest flavor and amazing texture. I ordered the philly roll and a couple martinis. Pretty solid place.

q_l96I8yalh_tTKajWp-RQ.text: Food is great, love the atmosphere but my god turn your air conditioning on. It's extremely uncomfortable. We asked to turn the air down and were told that's just how it is. Very hot.

NBDYwGidScnWoPVxhd-jJA.text: I thought we got lucky when we walked in the manager was at the front to welcome us for our first time. However during our meal we saw him checking on tables and being super friendly. While the service was amazing the Food was nuts. My boyfriend got the yellow curry (pictured) and I got the Toro (not pictured cause I ate it before he could take a picture.... Seriously get the Toro)  If you go, tell the staff what your evening is and they picked a table for us that was intimate and perfect date night restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yellow curry

yzSng7DPkbm5CRQhqMPcjQ.text: Sushi is an experience that varies person by person, so my review may not resonate with everyone.  I ordered fried wonton appetizer which unfortunately was a premade frozen item. I also ordered 2 rolls, spicy tuna and a tempura shrimp roll with tuna and jalapeno.  In my view spicy tuna is a True base measure of a sushi place. The spicy tuna roll was not great but not bad either.  The experience fell apart with the tempura roll.  The roll was made with hot tempura shrimp which heated the roll and changed the consistency of the rice and the taste of the cold tuna.  Unfortunately this prohibited me from finishing.

ghNK8PW5Dsc0XOQ9PD98Ng.text: The ambiance really brought the entire place to a whole new level. However, the food? It could have been better. I've been to many Japanese places and I've known places that serves really good Japanese cuisine. Aside from that, their knives are not sharp enough. As for food, as what I said, it didn't seem to appeal me in a really good way. It was just a typical sushi that can satisfy my craving, if I ever want to eat one. I ordered the assorted sushi platter for dinner and was just filled. Don't get me wrong, I was filled and satisfied but I am looking for something that will kick me off and say, "You must not forget me!" -- that thing.  Well, the experience seemed to be good, especially the friendly service that was shown to me by the servers working. Maybe, I'll try this place again next time.

85ODIaJyYxQSvqZsLr6-TQ.text: Took my girls visiting from Detroit over to squid ink for some sushi and this was their favorite spot.  Not only did we get seated in a comfy booth but the wait staff were all extremely friendly. They have happy hour starting at 3pm and it includes the same bombs which we all got one each! Definitely enough to share if you don't want to get day drunk.  My favorite sushi was definitely the Tahoe. It's soft shell crab fried and it was super flavorful. If you're into crab that's definitely the roll to get.   Every roll we got was fresh. Even the vegetarian roll that just had avocado. My friend Beth was not into sushi but she tried the rolls I got which was also spicy tuna and she loved it.  We also got the fried string beans as an appetizer also on the happy hour menu. It was delightful and light. I could eat them like chips.  All in all a great experience with great staff and delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Same bombs

IDw6-63Z94uzoFgWrjF3tA.text: Squid and Ink is beautiful to look at  and in a convenient location.  I enjoyed their decor and wall paintings, overall a very nice and original setting.  The food would get a B.  Passable but not great,    All the house rolls are on the higher price point, and although the combinations sounded interesting, the prices scared me away. I ended up having the lunch special which comes with one roll and an assortment of nigiris. The fish was fresh and the roll was rather standard  The miso soup which was included on the lunch special was off-putting, the broth did not have a lot of flavor and the mushrooms were crunchy and felt dehydrated.     I decided to try one of the rice bowls  and went with the one with salmon. On the positive side: it seems super healthy and packed with veggies, but it kind of lacks any flavor or excitement. The salmon is grilled, not fresh and felt a bit over cooked. There is no sauce or anything offered to spice up the dish and I  felt like i was just chewing on unseasoned boiled broccoli.   Would probably check out a different location for sushi the next time

G0T1GN1jbgRahR9cWDuo1A.text: Ok, on our way to J Lo concert and stopped at Squid Ink for a bite.  Place was packed, 20-25 minute wait (concert night I recommend getting here a little early)  After about 12 minutes a couple of seats opened up at the bar and we were lucky enough to grab them.  Couple of ice cold beers, Edemame, and we ordered the Cougar and Dirty RockStar.  The sushi was soooo awesome.    Sam was our bartender/server and she was fantastic.  She was super prompt, helped explain the two different sushi's that we ordered.    Met Mario the manager and he was super helpful when we signed in.  We try to come here and eat before every event downtown.  Double  UP...

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar at Squid Ink

6OrdWvDEUH0FCkdd6dNYEg.text: Was taking my toddler to a concert and decided we wanted food. I love sushi and decided to try squid ink. Atmosphere was great the booths and seating is good I like all the decoration and artwork. The restrooms are interesting as well. At first I thought the music may be too loud but once inside it's actually a good volume  I got the chef lunch sushi special which came with salmon tuna shrimp and albacore than a spicy crab roll and miso soup I added a Philadelphia roll as well. My son got the kids chicken and noodle and some miso. I have to say overall food was good. My issue is the rice was a lot and not much flavor didn't have enough vinegar. He after getting his food didn't want the noodles and chicken but that's a toddler for u. Miso was delicious Philadelphia roll wasn't bad but all I tasted was rice and bland rice.  Server was nice very helpful. Overall not a bad sushi place.

YsHKWG5s4Q8amjs5BzCsYw.text: Best spicy tuna bowl in my life! Spicy tuna with so much flavor and no mayo - what a dream. Paired with green onion, avocado, eggplant... incredible.  Garlic edamame was absolutely perfect too.

SV0uAX0ekoMDumgAYE0PGA.text: Love this spot!! Located in the heart of Cityscape downtown phx this place is great! We came here before a comedy show and arrived during happy hour. We were seated right away and the vibe was great! Not too crazy, not too crowded and not crazy loud music. We ordered off of the happy menu, which was a great selection of a little bit of everything as well as a really good drink menu! I really enjoyed the ambiance of this place, the service was also really good, and attentive! The crab rangoons were delish as well as the spicy crab off of the happy menu! Probably one of the best spicy crab rolls I've ever Hade! The tempura green beans were sooo delish along with the dipping sauce as well! Honestly our food was great, and drinks! The manager Mario came by our table to check in and he was so nice and it was very meaningful to have him check in on us, he even took the time to take our picture! Overall, I would highly recommend this spot and we will be going back again soon!!

KZ1RWYW3UfjZJHZ0bmPjgg.text: I took my Wife here today for an amazing lunch. I had Yellow Curry Coconut Shrimp, and she had Asian Chicken Salad. Both tasted awesome and very flavorful. I told my Wife that when we come back next time, I want the same thing again. It was that good. I highly recommend this dish.

k8rW6z_DeF7BlwkOaj2pJA.text: The happy hour deal is 50 percent off so we took advantage of that and our total came out to 12 (1 app, 1 roll). It was the perfect snack.   The crab ragoon was the best one I've ever had. It had real and large crab chunks inside of it. I would get it again for sure.   We also got the Vegas roll. It was decent, I wouldn't mind getting t again but may try something else next time.

3uk7nzHdHb3keLPwn8874w.text: We went out for date night and hubby surprised me by taking me to Squid Ink. It's a nice little place in downtown Phoenix. When we arrived, the manager met us at the door and set us up in a nice private booth. He even started our drink order and served them himself and then gave some recommendations of what he enjoyed eating. My husband got the double baked wings and fries. He stated "These wings are the best I've had in a long time, and the fries are really good too!" For a sushi place, wings are the last thing one would probably try, but they were delicious! I got a few classic rolls like the spicy tuna and the Philadelphia roll. I loved every bite!! We definitely plan on returning again. Thank you Squid Ink for a great night!

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love love love sushi!!!
Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The double baked wings and fries are the best!!

jc7BILt_toFXmiuKrrvHJw.text: My fiance and I stopped here for a bite before a comedy show. We were sat quickly and the food was on point! We both had sushi rolls, edamame and I had the wings as well. The only improvement I would say is the attentiveness of the waiter. He was scattered all over the restaurant and we had a tough time flagging him down for refills and the check. Overall a great experience and will definitely be going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Wings

1QZUCvbUs33-Ne0XENFzJA.text: This is more of 2.5 review.  We came here during lunch we had a reservation, we were a party of 8. The staff was friendly they allowed me to decorate the table before my party arrived. I do not eat sushi but everyone else does. That being said the crab ragoons were very good, the pot stickers were good as well. I decided to order a beef rib rice bowl. I can't review on that because well... it never came. I ordered and then all the food came. I ask the server again and he said he will go check on it. The tab was paid and were ready to leave and all the waiter said he didn't know what happened to it. So needless to say, I did not eat. However, the drinks were good. It took a while to get our drinks too, but they were good. Everyone else said the sushi was good.

3vvzC0lk-1dOhMAgTZhJsw.text: Nestled in the hustle and bustle of downtown Phoenix lies Squid Ink. An upscale, overly hyped and over priced restaurant where the sushi lacks inspiration and the cocktails elicit a "meh". But good effort. It makes me feel like I'm the kind of boujee who could afford the $13 Deep Water cocktail because it was presented in a martini glass. But don't get me wrong. It was still pretty good. As was the garlic edamame and Japanese fried chicken. Do I want to pay $11 again for the chicken appetizer? No.   The sushi rolls are over priced for what they are. They don't taste any differently than, say, your typical grocery store sushi you pick up on the way home after a hard work day. You knowingly buy it, and you understand that it's not some burst of flavor or a sudden meld of ingredients meant to be when you taste the first piece. It's a mediocre fix to the sushi cravings you don't have time to sit down for and attend to at an upscale restaurant. So what's the excuse at Squid Ink? The philly roll-a simple, ordered more times for those who like to play it safe kind of roll - fell flat. I didn't think it was possible. It's just fish and cream cheese. What's so hard about it? Dousing your dragon rolls in eel sauce doesn't make it better. The $14 Tahoe roll had a weird texture. Adding fried crab in it doesn't make it better. Again, where is the flavor?   What turned the experience more south for me was the ramen. My god. I think it's an insult to add this to your menu. The broth was bland, the soft boiled egg had no...flavor. There wasn't anything to it except that it was just...an egg. I can't really explain it. It was an egg but it wasn't a good egg. The bean sprouts did nothing to contribute to the dish and is just a waste of an ingredient. To add insult to the injury that is the ramen, we pay an extra $5 for 3 pieces of pork belly. Although the meat was tender, it could not save the broth. And the broth is everything. It's what MAKES your ramen delicious. I get it. You're a sushi restaurant. You're not tailored to make ramen, but don't add it to the menu and expect patrons to be satisfied paying $15 for a bowl of disappointment. We're already paying $14 for speciality rolls that weren't that great to begin with. Did I eat all the components in the ramen? Darn right I did. I paid $15 for that bowl.   On the plus side, your lighting is awesome during the day for food photo ops.

photos.caption: Photo of Squid Ink Sushi - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Garlic Edamame.
